title: Indian Film Fraternity Lauds IAF’s Air-Strike On Pakistan’s Terror Launch-Pads
text:
Weeks after the Pulwama attack, Indian Air Force (IAF) dropped 1,000 kg of bombs in regions of Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK) early on Tuesday and targeted terror camps in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK), sources said.
The strikes involving several fighter jets of the Indian Air Force successfully destroyed camps belonging to Pakistan-based terror outfits in Balakot in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, the sources told news agency PTI. The extent of the damage inflicted on the ground is not immediately known.
(Also read: Here Is All About Mirage-2000, IAF's Key Fighter Which Has Been Kicking Pakistan For 20 Years)
As per reports, IAF used 12 Mirage 2000 fighter jets in the operation, which bombed regions like Balakot, Muzaffarabad, Chakothi at around 3:30 am today. The mission was a success as it managed to destroy three alpha control rooms and several terrorist lauchpads across the LOC.
Reacting to the news, the film fraternity have been lauding the defence forces.

Taapsee Pannu and Anupam Kher too reacted to the news with emojis such as the victory sign and a hashtag ‘Bharat Mata Ki Jai’.
